dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4446 IH: Focused Assistance and Skills Training for Veterans’ Employment and Transition Success Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Dexter (for herself, Mr. Messmer, Mr. McGarvey, and Mr. Van Orden) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to modify the conditions under which the Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to redevelop the individualized vocational rehabilitation plan for a veteran, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Focused Assistance and Skills Training for Veterans’ Employment and Transition Success Act or the FAST VETS Act.

section.header: Conditions under which Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall redevelop individualized vocational rehabilitation plan
section.text: Section 3107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended in subsection (b)—

paragraph.text: by striking The Secretary shall review and inserting (1) The Secretary shall review;
by striking the second sentence; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
On the basis of such review, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: redevelop such plan with such veteran if the Secretary determines the achievement of the long-range rehabilitation goals for such veteran is—

clause.text: no longer feasible due to changes in the employment handicap of the veteran; and
likelier under a different plan formulated under subsection (a); or

subparagraph.text: disapprove redevelopment of such plan if the Secretary determines such redevelopment is not appropriate.
